Description:
This school started in 1989 on NCF Church campus. A group of intrepid church members felt that they needed to start a pre-school to serve the wider community of Pietermaritzburg. NCF Church embraced the idea of formal education on its land and endeavoured to assist. After 10 years of running a pre-school it was decided by Mrs W Fath (the first principal) to open a primary school. Since the first Grade 1 class of 1999 the school has experienced much positive growth. Mr B Mouton became the second principal in 2004. With a growing school and adjacent church it was decided to focus mainly on pre-school and junior primary from 2006. Since 2006 the focus of this school was to grow qualitatively and partner with neighbouring schools. Over the years the school added classrooms, sports fields and a swimming pool to its facilities. In June 2014 the school changed its name and badge, becoming Maritzburg Preparatory School. The school focuses on a qualitative approach to its foundation phase, and aims to be known for its love for children and its dedication as a team (staff, learners and parents) to giving the best all-round early education.Maritzburg Preparatory School, Alexandra Road, Westgate, Pietermaritzburg, South Africa, South AfricaMonday7:00 am - 3:00 pmTuesday7:00 am - 3:00 pmWednesday7:00 am - 3:00 pmThursday7:00 am - 3:00 pmFriday7:00 am - 3:00 pmSaturdayClosedSundayClosed

Description:
Welcome to Kildrummy Pre-Primary and Daycare At Kildrummy, we believe that children should learn through play, be involved, engaged and most importantly, do so in a safe, clean and nurturing environment. We offer an integrated curriculum for infants and young children from ages 3 months, to 6 years. Our mission is to create a happy, motivating and nurturing environment structured to encourage "Learning through play". Well qualified staff aim to ensure that development of the whole child - cognitively, physically, emotionally and socially - is implemented. Our vision is to ensure that children are empowered with life skills at an early age in order to become confident and successful in their adult lives. We are located in Paulshof, in a boomed area which provides the essential security for a safe educational environment, and we can accommodate children from all surrounding areas: Paulshof, Bryanston, Sunninghill, Lonehill, Petervale, Rivonia and Fourways.Kildrummy Pre Primary, Komari Avenue, Paulshof, Sandton, South Africa, South AfricaMonday7:00 am - 3:00 pmTuesday7:00 am - 3:00 pmWednesday7:00 am - 3:00 pmThursday7:00 am - 3:00 pmFriday7:00 am - 3:00 pmSaturdayClosedSundayClosed

Description:
Boys School St Alban's College is a young, vibrant Anglican boys' school, with Grades 8 to 12. It came into existence on 1 February 1963 with a total of 37 boys and a complement of 3 masters. We now number over 560 boys and over 60 teachers, plus an array of support staff. From its very inception it has been a school that loves a challenge. The founder-Headmaster, Anton Murray, was a South African cricketer who sought to maintain the best traditions of liberal education. So an emphasis on well-rounded development prevails, and games such as cricket, rugby and hockey have always figured prominently in our history. Our history of embracing diversity and making a difference in the broader community is also well established. Approaching our 50th anniversary in 2013, St Alban's College is established and secure but never complacent . Description:
Welcome to Child Wise Nursery School We are a dual medium Christian based pre-school that caters for little ones from 1 Month up to Grade R. Child Wise's owner and staff are experienced, qualified individuals with a child first approach. We offer small classes, loving teachers and ample interaction. Child Wise focuses on individual attention for each child with a view to foster physical, social, emotional, intellectual and spiritual development providing a sound foundation for his/her future. We offer delicious and nutritious meals, all in a loving environment with a home away from home atmosphere. Because we value the safety and health of our learners, our staff are required to renew their CPR and First Aid training annually. School gates conveniently open at 06h00 in the morning for the early birds. The official school day will however begin at 08h00. The school closes at 18h00 in the afternoon and at 13h00 for half day learners. Description:
We are a Grade 8 to 12 private school in Table View. We were founded in May 2004 after realising a great demand in our immediate community for education that meets the needs of the individual. We have created a secure environment conducive to bringing out the best in our learners through small classes and individual attention where needed. We are the proud recipients of a Dean's Honours Award from the EMS faculty at the University of the Western Cape, in recognition of the outstanding Academic Performance of some of our ex-learners over the recent years. One of our learners was the top student of 2009 and received the International Golden Key Award. Description:
Dalpark Private School is an Independent Primary School that caters for learners from Grade R to Grade 7. The school boasts small classes (not exceeding 30 learners) and well-qualified teachers. Dalpark Private is not merely an educational institution; it is a warm, welcoming, comfortable, diversely rich place, which changes "enough" into "more", "chaos" into "order", "confusion" into "clarity", "strangers" into "friends" and much more. The Educators at this school have a great passion for what they do. They are of a high calibre and are always striving to achieve and improve and educate to the best of their ability. Description:
ACUDEO College is founded in the Christian faith and principles. ACUDEO is a composite word with the roots Acumen, the ability to think clearly, make good decisions and exercise sound judgement and Deo, which is Greek for God. The name Acudeo embodies growing one's knowledge and skills in the presence and under the guidance of God I am Emmanuel Ramathavha and I am very excited to be the founding Principal of ACUDEO College Kirkney. My passion is education and I have been involved in the profession for 14 years. I started out as a Physical Science teacher in rural Kwa-Zulu Natal (e-Nkandla) in 2003. As a young teacher the experience in KZN taught me to do more with less and to appreciate the power of education in changing lives and as a tool to develop our country. In 2009, I joined the Gauteng Department of Education at Eqinisweni Secondary in Ivory Park (one of the best performing high schools in the township). I served the school as a Physical Science educator and later Head of Department for Sciences. The experience presented me with an opportunity to join Mindset (DSTV channel 319) as a Physical Science tutor.Â Simonsberg Ave, Kirkney, Pretoria, 0182, South AfricaMonday7:00 am - 3:00 pmTuesday7:00 am - 3:00 pmWednesday7:00 am - 3:00 pmThursday7:00 am - 3:00 pmFriday7:00 am - 3:00 pmSaturdayClosedSundayClosed

Description:
Penryn is situated in a stunning bushveld setting on the Boschrand Hills overlooking Nelspruit and the Crocodile River Valley. The College started as a twinning project with St Stithians College in Randburg with a view to establishing an institution in the Lowveld that would provide quality, holistic education in a Christian setting, and would partner schools in rural communities surrounding Nelspruit. Accordingly from a start in 1991 with 7 scholars in Gr 1, the College has grown to 1 000 co-educational scholars in 2010, and a community initiative called Penreach now partners over 2 000 teachers from partner schools each year in a rich and meaningful programme that continues to upgrade education in surrounding communities. ? Description:
St Andrew's School for Girls is a Christian school situated on the eastern side of Johannesburg in beautiful surroundings. The school offers a wealth of opportunities for young women to embrace. Our academic programme is challenging and imaginative, designed to foster intellectual curiosity and a lifelong love of learning. It is essential that all in our charge are equipped to take on the challenges of change and progress. Bus services are available on certain routes. Both the preschool and junior school offer aftercare facilities. Preschool We cater for boys and girls from three months to five years. Our groups are small and each child receives individual attention and plenty of love and care. There is a large, beautiful playground. We have a holistic approach to learning and aim to educate each child in all aspects of development - socially, emotionally physically, musically, creatively and linguistically. Description:
Tshikevha Christian School was established in 1986 in Venda, Limpopo Province in South Africa. The school was established at the initiative of parents of the Reformed Churches in Venda concerned with the level of education and the moral of educators in general together with Dutch missionaries sent to Venda by the Christian Reformed Churches in the Netherlands. The aim to establish the school was to pursue Christian education where children of Christian parents could be taught and raised in the fear of the Lord. The school also plays a mission role in that we also admit children with no Christian background who get introduced to Christianity for the first time in the school. Children enrolled in our school are taught from the earliest stages of their lives that everything they are taught, and learn at school is what God created and that apart from Gods creation there is absolutely nothing to teach and to learn. The school achieves excellent grade 12 results every year, including 100% pass for the past three years.Â Makwarela, Thohoyandou, 0950, South AfricaMonday7:00 am - 3:00 pmTuesday7:00 am - 3:00 pmWednesday7:00 am - 3:00 pmThursday7:00 am - 3:00 pmFriday7:00 am - 3:00 pmSaturdayClosedSundayClosed

Description:
Happy Feet Nursery School, White River, is a pre-school which started dominating the pre-schools arena in White River and the surrounding communities soon after it was started in 2015. It is a school where the children always look forward to going each and every day, but that is not the end of the story: parents too take much pleasure and pride in dropping their little ones to the school each morning. It is so amazing to find children from different backgrounds co-existing together with common purpose and unity in happiness. Yes, Happy Feet! The interest and confidence of the parents is clearly evident during the annual concert show. It feels like if you do not have your kids at Happy Feet, then you are missing out big time! Description:
Our Pre-Primary school is situated on the premises of Willow Academy. We have two classes- the Giraffes and the Lions which cater for Grade 0 and Grade R. We pride ourselves in providing a wide variety of activities and a strong Bible-based curriculum. We teach our children to love and respect God, their neighbours and themselves. We believe that training children to have faith in God from a young age plays a vital role in their life. In our Primary School we have a well rounded education program incorporating Government approved CAPS and a Beka Christian text books. In all our grades we teach from a Christian worldview perspective and maintain strong Christian values. Our small classes enable learners to reach their maximum potential. From Grade 1-3 we encourage our learners to memorise scriptures and poems as part of their curriculum. The High School we mentor our learners, preparing them for their future and to be a light to the world. All our subjects are taught from a Christian perspective and with Christian values. Our Mission Statement To respect/accept and uniqueness and individuality of each Learner. Description:
Kyrios Independent School was established in 2011 when the owners were faced with serious challenges with regards to their youngest son's schooling. As busy "business owning" parents who care deeply about their children, they needed to find the best possible solution. They decided to employ a teacher to home-school their son. This turned out to be a successful endeavour as their son's results and his attitude improved significantly. It became apparent that sometimes so called "difficult or impossible" kids who are often rejected by other institutions simply required more individual attention and adapted engagement methods that are not readily available in larger schools with high density classrooms. Soon there were requests from friends to join the home-schooling group, and as they realised that most of these kids were desperate, they allowed them to join. The result: for the 2011 school year the six matric pupils in the school all passed successfully. This is still the heart of Kyrios.Kyrios Independent School, Bloemfontein, South Africa, South AfricaMonday7:00 am - 3:00 pmTuesday7:00 am - 3:00 pmWednesday7:00 am - 3:00 pmThursday7:00 am - 3:00 pmFriday7:00 am - 3:00 pmSaturdayClosedSundayClosed

Description:
Chartwell Country College is founded on the basic belief that all individuals are unique. We believe that all children are capable of teaching as well as learning, and we take cognisance of this in all our interactions with our students. Our focus, therefore, is on developing the individual, not in moulding them into the strictures of conformity or the traditions of an institution, expecting them to perform in areas they are clearly not suited to. Too often we have seen the breakdown of a child's self-esteem, the labels that are attached and the medication unnecessarily administered to keep a child from disrupting a class environment unable to nurture and contain them. Description:
New Hanover Preparatory School is a co-educational Pre-Primary and Primary school, offering education in a country setting from Grade RRR to Grade 7. As the 6th oldest independent school in South Africa, New Hanover Prep is steeped in a rich heritage of 150 years of Christian-based education. With a strong core of values that include Christian Faith, a Sense of Self, Integrity and a Sense of Belonging, New Hanover Prep inspires learners to maximise their unique potential in a Christian environment. Dynamic facilitators develop essential foundational skills, thus enabling children to meet the challenges of the future. Set on a 14 hectare campus, just 35km from Pietermaritzburg our school overlooks the hills of the KZN Midlands. Within our small school environment, our children enjoy the benefits of vast sports fields, including a flood-lit field, tennis courts, netball courts, a networked computer centre, Audio-Visual room, library, outdoor pavilion, art room, aftercare, transport routes and so much more.
